news.title: Man attacked woman with axe and set fire to her Kildare home before taking his own life
news.summary: A man (50s) attacked a woman (50s) with an axe and set fire to her home before taking his own life in Co Kildare this morning.

news.title: Tragic loss 'a shock to everyone’ – Bus Éireann pays tribute to bus driver killed alongside lorry driver in multi-vehicle crash in Co Meath
news.summary: Two people have died following a serious multi-vehicle crash in Co Meath this morning.

news.title: ‘For God’s sake!’ – Micheál Martin hits back at ‘cheap’ criticism of his foreign travel from inside Fianna Fáil
news.summary: The Taoiseach has rounded on domestic critics of his world travel and leadership performance as he flies home tonight from Angola, a day early.

news.title: Fraudster and former Celtic Tiger property developer Conor Clarkson declared bankrupt with debts over €56m
news.summary: A convicted fraudster, who was a well-known property developer and racehorse owner during the Celtic Tiger era, has been declared bankrupt with debts of more than €56m.

news.title: Ireland rugby jury: Rating the Autumn performances, Andy Farrell’s biggest issues, and the Six Nations bolters
news.summary: Our rugby jury debate Ireland’s performances in the Autumn Nations series and Andy Farrell’s biggest issues ahead of the 2026 Six Nations, among other hot topics.

news.title: Man (55) who strangled his mother (75) in her home guilty of murder as jury rejects insanity defence
news.summary: A jury has unanimously convicted a Kerry man of murdering his 75-year-old mother, rejecting his claim that he should be found not guilty by reason of insanity.

news.title: ‘He lost the run of himself’ – man jailed for going on rampage through Dublin Airport and causing €9,400 worth of damage after missing flight
news.summary: A man who caused more than €9,400 worth of damage at Dublin Airport after he missed his flight has been jailed for one year.

news.title: ‘He told me to take the joystick and crack on’ – Man (90) reaches for the sky once more, seven decades after first flying lesson
news.summary: A man from Co Antrim is learning how to fly at the ripe old age of 90 – more than 70 years after his first lesson.

news.title: Chris Wasser: Why nostalgia means shows like Moulin Rouge! and Mean Girls are coming to a stage near you
news.summary: We should probably address the witches. With a second  Wicked  film ­arriving in cinemas this week, it makes sense to shine a light on the fruitful and occasionally fascinating partnership between Hollywood and the stage.

news.title: ‘It was a racket. But it was a racket RTÉ started’ – Myles Dungan on freelance contracts, losing ‘Late Date’ and moving into fiction writing
news.summary: For the most part, Myles ­Dungan is reliably sardonic and self-deprecating. The writing of his excellent new novel,  The Red Branch , a historical espionage thriller about ­“Fenians who are at it again” in 19th-century San Francisco, sprung from “the joy of making shit up”.
